intro: Lithospermum discolor var. canescens, commonly known as the pale-stemmed lithospermum, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often bluish-gray stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots contain compounds with potential medicinal properties, though it is not widely cultivated for commercial use. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and prairie habitats.
